meanings.definition: To hinder or impede progress or movement.
meanings.sent1: Heavy traffic hampers our journey to the park.
meanings.sent2: The broken bridge hampers the delivery trucks.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock hampers our plans for a quick escape.
meanings.sent4: Fear can sometimes hamper our ability to take risks.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog hampers visibility on the road.

meanings.definition: A large basket with a lid used for storing or carrying items.
meanings.sent1: She packed her picnic in a beautiful hamper.
meanings.sent2: The hamper in the corner holds all the toys.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat jumped into the hamper and got stuck.
meanings.sent4: The hamper overflowed with fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The hamper by the door is full of dirty laundry.

meanings.definition: A set of baskets or containers used for carrying food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The picnic hamper contained sandwiches and drinks.
meanings.sent2: The waiter carried the elegant hamper to the table.
meanings.sent3: The hamper of goodies was a delightful surprise.
meanings.sent4: The hamper of treats was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent5: The hamper of snacks disappeared quickly at the gathering.
